definition: (interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin

sentences.english: Investigators tried to speak to him on Sunday but Hasan asked for a lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 調查人員試圖於週日跟哈桑談話，但他要求見律師。

sentences.english: But Hassan doesn’t have a chauvinist bone in his body.
sentences.chinese: 但是哈桑的骨子裏並沒有沙文主義在體內。

sentences.english: Hassan died on his way to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 哈桑在被送往醫院搶救的路上死亡。
哈桑跟我目瞪口呆，愣住了。

sentences.english: Hassan said, point to the sky, he stood up and walked a few steps toward the left.
sentences.chinese: 哈桑說，指向天空，他站起身來，朝左邊走了幾步。

sentences.english: Major Hasan was shot four times during the attack.
sentences.chinese: 哈桑少校在襲擊發生後身中四槍。

sentences.english: After his return to Bahrain from America, Hassan taught at Bahrain University.
sentences.chinese: 這次從美國返回巴林後，哈桑在巴林大學任教。

sentences.english: Afghan girls attend their first day of class at a school in the village of Deh Hassan.
sentences.chinese: 阿富汗女孩在出席哈桑的德赫村校的第一天上課。

sentences.english: I shook Hassan awake and asked him if he wanted to hear a story.
sentences.chinese: 我把哈桑搖醒，問他是否願意聽個故事。

sentences.english: They say he may have advised Army Major Nidal Malik Hasan.
sentences.chinese: 他們說，他可能建議陸軍少校尼達爾馬利克哈桑。

sentences.english: Hasan flinched after he was shot and slid down against the pole still clutching his gun, which had a laser sight on it.
sentences.chinese: 當哈桑被擊中後，他向後退縮，並倒在柱子後面。

sentences.english: Police found Aasiya Hassan’s body at the television station.
sentences.chinese: 警方發現Aasiya哈桑的屍體在電視臺。

sentences.english: He said he now believes Mr. Hasan has since been tapping into his wireless service.
sentences.chinese: 他說現在他堅信哈桑從那以後一直在利用他的無線網。

sentences.english: Hassan and Nassau lead the caravan and sand fight.
sentences.chinese: 哈桑老人和兒子納蘇，帶領商隊與風沙搏鬥。

sentences.english: "Just keep walking, " I muttered to Hassan.
sentences.chinese: “別理他，快走”我小聲對哈桑說。

definition: Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God/also written 穆罕默德
(loanword) caliph/also written 哈利發|哈利发[ha1 li4 fa1]
Sudan/sultan (ruler of some Muslim states, esp. Ottoman Emperor)
Suleiman (name)/General Michel Suleiman (1948-), Lebanese military man and politician, president of Lebanon 2008-2014
Bashir (name)/Omar Hassan Ahmad al-Bashir (1944-), Sudanese military man and politician, president of Sudan from 1993
